text: 'Growing up in Hoboken

author: Mr. C
text: "This is the only Pizzeria I will deal with. I've been in Hoboken 41 years. Everything in this place is good. They don't skip out on ingredients like the other places do. I will not order from any other place when it comes to pizzerias"

column7: and convenient location!\nWhat more can one ask for ?!'

text: 'Torna is the real deal.  This very plain looking joint puts out whT may be the best pizza in town.   Especially loving the square slices.'

author: Elijah Quinones
text: 'Best place in Hoboken hands down'

author: Ken Adams
text: 'Nothing fancy. Great for your classic ‚ÄúNY slice‚Äù.'

author: Jade Briggs
text: 'Moving to Hoboken a little over six months ago I‚Äôve spent ridiculous prices on terrible pizza. I saw this place a few times walking by and decided to give it a try. Coming from NY I know good finds come in small places. I was on the money. The sauce they use is very flavorful. The delivery comes quick the staff are very kind and again the pizza is everything!'

text: 'My favorite place for a slice.'

text: 'Best Chicken Parmesan sandwich around! The Sicilian slice is a Hoboken staple
column5: prepared with fresh with muzt and sauce when you order. Delivery is always quick and accurate.'

author: Righteous Family
text: 'Not the same as I remember from my early years growing up in Hoboken'

author: Casey James Scheiner
text: "This is unfortunate as I am very proud to have been a long-time pizza blogger (thatssocheezy
column5: com)
column6: but this place was very disappointing.\n\nI had always passed it as my wife had  lived right above the pharmacy
column7: so the one day (around 3 years ago) I grabbed a slice. They unfortunately had to cook a new pie cause the previous one burnt (I guess reasonable)
column8: but they couldn't provide me change because they didn't have money in the till and though polite
column9: seemed pretty uncaring that I waited 20 minutes for a slice.\n\nA lot of people swear by this place as a good night place
column10: but maybe my experience was just the rare poorly executed one. I hope to come back one day and not be disappointed."

author: Robb Nunez
text: 'Great food. Fast service'

author: CurlsnPearlsss
text: 'BEST SICILIAN SLICE EVER! Also love their meatball parm sandwich & stuffed shells. Great sauce and love their service. Been a fan since childhood.'

text: 'Love the pizza kit! Comes with dough
column5: sauce
column6: and mozzarella. Perfect dinner at home.'

text: 'Best Sicilian slices around!'

author: nema
text: 'Classic'

author: Michael Rosado
text: 'Best pizza ever!'

author: Javier Duran
text: 'Baked ziti always great .great place to eat pizza meatballs parmesan'

author: Codi Franmaio
text:
'Ordered for delivery a small pizza with onions (menu says 10 inches) and received an extra small pizza (8 inches and virtually no onions) that Looked about the size of a slice. And all this (sarcasm) cost me $12 lol. Thanks for nothing!

In Response to Owner:

You had a chance to make it right yesterday when I first called to bring your attention to this issue. When I said I wanted my money back because of the inadequacy of the pizza
column5: I was told that I would have to give back the pizza. So you had your delivery guy return to pick up the pizza. Why not just offer me a full refund and let me keep the pizza for the inconvenience? That is how you could have made it right
column6: but you didn‚Äôt. How are you proposing to make it right now
column7: by me ordering another pizza from you and paying for it? That is certainly right for you but it does nothing for me. What a joke!'

author: Carmen Reyes
text: 'Omg the worse pizza I had in my life never in my life I just order a pizza from this place they took like to hours and the pizza was nasty ufff I hope me and my grandkids DNT get sick.'

author: Stephen Forte
text: 'classic Italian family'

author: Matthew Riley
text: 'Probably the best plain slice in town. Open very late on the weekends'

text: 'They coming here for 20 years Pizza never changes just the people
column5: wonderful times'

author: Norma Matias
text: "The food was good
column5: but that is not Torna chef
column6: been there for years don't know what happen
column7: but the food is not Torna..ü§î"

author: Bushido Ken
text: 'Great neighborhood food. I grew around the corner and cousin Mike and his family used to always take care of me when I went in. Whether my brother and I had money or not
column5: we were always welcomed with a nice warm meal. Best sicilians in Town'

author: Joshua De Leon
text: "I have been visiting Tornas for over 20 years and I order a Sicilian slice almost every time.  Once in a while I do get some other things on the menu like mozzarella sticks and wings
column5: sometimes a regular pie but I think the Sicilian pizza is the best thing here.   I used to be a huge fan of their hot sandwiches for the size and price but ever since the old Italian lady that used to cook at Tornas passed away the food hasn't tasted as delicious as it was before.   Tornas food used to be super good  and now it's just OK that's why I'm giving them 3 stars.  Don't get me wrong the food is good and you get decent portions it's just not like it used to be.  If you order food for delivery try to order early on weekends because they can get very busy and you'll end up waiting for an hour or more any other time it's fast."

author: Jeff Sklar
text: 'too long for a pizza.  1 hour plus'

author: MICAH 7:8
text: 'TREMENDOUS PIZZA! I LOVE TORNAS I MISS HOBOKEN.'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "I've tried many of the abundant pizza places in Hoboken but I didn't even know Torna's existed until I saw it on the Slice app. We ordered for pickup one Thursday evening. We tried a regular slice
column5: Sicilian slice
column8: and the meatball parm platter. The regular slice is nothing to write home about. There are plenty of better slices in the neighborhood
column9: so don't go out of your way for this. But that Sicilian slice...might be one of the best I've had in life. It's light and fluffy with plenty of ooey gooey cheese. If you get a topping
column10: they put it under the cheese
column11: which was an interesting twist that I enjoyed.\n\nYou can skip all of the other dishes - especially the chicken tenders. Chicken tenders from the supermarket freezer section taste better than this. We only ordered it because we had a minimum to meet for a coupon we wanted to use
column12: and it was supposed to come with French fries (which I was craving
column13: and we saw it was missing when we got home).\n\nI'd definitely come back for a Sicilian slice

author: Gladys Massol
text: 'I always go to visit my friend Tony and Mike they are verry kind and wonderful people I know this place for lots of years'

author: serenity cuevas
text: 'Amazing! Best pizza in NJ! Love there sicilians!!'

author: Michael John
text: "Great pizza shop. Fair prices
column5: quality ingredients
column6: casual environment. I'd recommend this to anyone."

author: Tim Leonard
text: 'Convenient location but not my first choice for pizza'

author: del forc
text: 'Great deals
column5: great people. Mikes the best!'

author: Linda Morando
text: 'I love Tornas its my favorite pizza. I love the sicilian slice and love that they make it fresh to order!'

author: Frank Brennan
text: 'The place changed ownership. The prices went up and the product quality and taste had declined.  They once had the best lasagna for $12. Now it is more money and not nearly as good.  The pizza was also better before.  They did change the interior and make it a little more updated but still
column5: not any better than a basic pizza parlor.  I hope they can go back to the old recipes.'

text: "I've only ordered here via GrubHub
column5: so I can't say anything about their service
column6: but their food is very good on it's own
column7: and especially so when you consider the prices. Nice lowkey spot to try."

text: 'Childhood pizzeria and the best meatball parm sandwich.'

column6: and Great Prices. Thank You for making my Bday lunch great!!!\n\n- Marisol (Haven Savings Bank)'

author: JJ
text:
'Pizza is always either BURNT
or UNDERCOOKED.
I think they need a new oven
OR people that know how to cook pizza.
The ingredients are good.'

text: 'Best sicilian in Hudson county'

text: "BEST SICILIAN SLICES! Great service and great food

author: Karl Arache
text: 'I‚Äôm a union city resident and I drive all the way to Hoboken at any time of day and night.  They by far have the best Sicilian pizzas in all of jersey.  The chicken parm sandwiches are amazing and the wings fuggetaboutit.....and not only that
column5: but they are open til 4am on fridays and saturdays
column6: and they deliver.  There‚Äôs no reason to go anywhere else!!!!'

text: 'Very good'

author: Jesse Rodriguez
text: 'Being born and raised in Hoboken
column5: family owned Tornas is a landmark. Their Sicilian with extra sauce (personal favorite)

text: 'Buttery sausage pie !'

author: Myles Helfand
text: 'OK-tasting standard NJ pizza in super-casual digs with a family-run vibe. (Which can feel either home-y or awkward when a couple of them are arguing with one another.) Good prices relative to nearby pizza places.'

text:

author: Jerome Otis-Harris
text: "Torna Pizzeria is the best pizza in Hoboken...HANDS DOWN!!!!!! I live in bayonne and I travel all the way to Hoboken to get a slice. Chicken parm is to die for and don't get me started on the Sicilian with pepperoni. WHEN YOU GO THERE ASK FOR COUSIN MIKE"

author: Michael Quijano
text: 'Good late night pizza. Pros are that they are open late. The employees are all good people. Family run. Family owned. Family cared.'

text: 'Sicilian slice is very unique and delicious'

author: Jake Fallin
text: "Really great pizza. Arguably the best price per slice value in Hoboken. It's a little greasy but if you like that then this is your place. This is the definition of a hole in a wall
column5: which as a general rule usually has better food."

text: 'Great family n great homemade pasta....Lov it'

text: 'Love this place; love the family who runs it. Class acts and fantastic food.'

author: Robert Amato
text: 'The baked ziti and meatballs are both insane. If you grew up Italian
column5: you know how good this place is.  The Sicilian w sauce on top is a Hoboken staple.'

author: Aaron Boucher
text: 'The Sicilian and the Chicken Parm Sandwich (get a large) are amazing.'

author: DARIN CICCHINE
text: 'There Sicilian pie is amazing'

author: Steven jonees
text: "OLD SCHOOL HOBOKEN PIZZA!!!  GOT THAT? HO-BO-KEN.  LOVE THIS PIZZA!  the family who owns it is great and love them all.  One of the FEW genuine places left in hoboken.   Why others are giving it bad reviews is beyond me. It's not dominoes [you should be ashamed of yourself if you come to hoboken and buy dominoes or Pizza Hut].  It's thick crust and it's old school.   Thank you for still being here!  Oh did I mention the great price ?!  Yeah! Viva Tornas!"

author: Chris Giunta
text: 'Hoboken has so many amazing pizza places and Italian restaurants...and they are all better than torna.'

author: Seretse Clouden
text: "Didn't get my delivery order correct and I wanted some pizza with all my grease"

author: Angela Ruggiero
text: "Love it its old school love the thin crust they always make my pizza just way I like it I'm a torna girl all the way"

author: Orlando Mendez
text: "Folks if you only Like to go to Fine White Linen Restaurants with a Great Wine List
column5: this place is NOT FOR YOU.  Torna Pizzeria is a Great little place to get and perhaps take Out Pretty Darned Decent Home Cooked Style Food. Though the Pizza is Not the Best
column6: I've had Much Worse. The MONSTER Meat Balls are Fantastic! This is a Pretty Darned Decent Kitchen with Great Prices. Abbondanza!"
